channel.title: Nathans Note space
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Nathans Note space

item.title: Bayes' Theorem
item.description: When you’re talking about statistics, it’s impossible not to see the direct connection to probability.

item.title: QQ-Plots
item.description: A QQ-plot (Quantile–Quantile plot) is a graphical tool used to assess whether your sample data comes from a specific theoretical distribution — most commonly, the normal distribution.

item.title: The Kolmogorov-Lilliefors Test
item.description: The Lilliefors test is a modification of the Kolmogorov–Smirnov (KS) test that accounts for the fact that we often don’t know the population mean and variance in advance — and instead estimate them from the sample.

item.title: The Kolmogorov–Smirnov (KS) Test
item.description: The KS test is a non-parametric method used to determine whether a sample comes from a specific continuous distribution.

item.title: Chi Squared Goodness of fit testing
item.description: What is the purpose of the test Suppose you have a dataset, and you want to evaluate how well it aligns with a particular discrete probability distribution.

item.title: Here Are the Most UFO-Friendly States in the U.S.
item.description: Where in America are you most likely to spot something strange in the sky — and actually report it? Each year, thousands of Americans file reports of unidentified flying objects.

item.title: Tools That I Can't Live Without
item.description: I’ve always loved reading about how other people work — what tools they rely on to stay productive, focused, and creative.

item.title: Welcome to My Notes
item.description: This is a public digital garden built with Quartz.
